00002 * $Id$          bitband.c                               2010-05-21

00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "debug_frmwrk.h"
00028 
00029 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00035 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINTIONS*************************/
00036 /* The processor memory map includes two bit-band regions. These occupy the lowest
00037  * 1MB of the SRAM and peripheral memory regions respectively.
00038  * + SRAM:      Bit-band region:        0x20000000 - 0x20100000
00039  *                      Bit-band alias:         0x22000000 - 0x23FFFFFF
00040  * + PERI:      Bit-band region:        0x40000000 - 0x40100000
00041  *                      Bit-band alias:         0x42000000 - 0x43FFFFFF
00042  * The mapping formula:
00043  *              bit_word_offset = (byte_offset * 32) + (bit_number * 4)
00044  *              bit_word_address = bit_band_base + bit_word_offset
00045  * where:
00046  *      + bit_word_offset: the position of the target bit in the bit-band memory region
00047  *      + bit_word_addr: the address of the word in the alias memory region that maps to the target bit
00048  *  + bit_band_base: the starting address of the alias region
00049  *  + byte_offset: the number of byte in the bit-band region that contains the targeted bit
00050  *  + bit_number: is the bit position (0-7) of the targeted bit
00051  *
00052  * Note: The fact, the SRAM on LPC1768 just available in two ranges:
00053  *      + 0x2007C000 - 0x2007FFFF: for SRAM - bank 0
00054  *  + 0x20080000 - 0x20083FFF: for SRAM - bank 1
00055  *  (And one range for GPIO peripheral but assigned in SRAM ranges: 0x2009C000 - 0x2009FFFF)
00056  */
00057 
00058 /* Bit band SRAM definitions */
00059 #define BITBAND_SRAM_REF   0x20000000
00060 #define BITBAND_SRAM_BASE  0x22000000
00061 
00062 #define BITBAND_SRAM(a,b) ((BITBAND_SRAM_BASE + ((a-BITBAND_SRAM_REF)<<5) + (b<<2)))  // Convert SRAM address
00063 
00064 /* Bit band PERIPHERAL definitions */
00065 #define BITBAND_PERI_REF   0x40000000
00066 #define BITBAND_PERI_BASE  0x42000000
00067 
00068 #define BITBAND_PERI(a,b) ((BITBAND_PERI_BASE + ((a-BITBAND_PERI_REF)<<5) + (b<<2)))  // Convert PERI address
00069 
00070 /* Basic bit band function definitions */
00071 #define BITBAND_SRAM_ClearBit(a,b)      (*(volatile uint32_t *) (BITBAND_SRAM(a,b)) = 0)
00072 #define BITBAND_SRAM_SetBit(a,b)        (*(volatile uint32_t *) (BITBAND_SRAM(a,b)) = 1)
00073 #define BITBAND_SRAM_GetBit(a,b)        (*(volatile uint32_t *) (BITBAND_SRAM(a,b)))
00074 
00075 #define BITBAND_PERI_ClearBit(a,b)      (*(volatile uint32_t *) (BITBAND_PERI(a,b)) = 0)
00076 #define BITBAND_PERI_SetBit(a,b)        (*(volatile uint32_t *) (BITBAND_PERI(a,b)) = 1)
00077 #define BITBAND_PERI_GetBit(a,b)        (*(volatile uint32_t *) (BITBAND_PERI(a,b)))
00078 
00079 /* Variable address in SRAM
00080  * should be in one of two range:
00081  *      + 0x2007C000 - 0x20083FFF: for SRAM
00082  *  + 0x20080000 - 0x20083FFF: for GPIO
00083  */
00084 #define VAR_ADDRESS             0x2007C000
00085 #define VAR_BIT                 3 //Bit 3
00086 
00087 /* Peripheral address
00088  * should be in range: 0x40000000 - 0x40100000
00089  */
00090 #define PERI_ADDRESS    0x40020000 // SPI Control Register (S0SPCR)
00091 #define PERI_BIT                5 //bit 5 - Master mode select
00092 
00093 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00094 uint8_t menu[]=
00095         "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00096         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00097         "Bit-banding demo \n\r"
00098         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00099         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00100         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00101         "This example used to test Bit-banding feature of Cortex-M3 processor\n\r"
00102         "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00103 
00104 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00105 /*********************************************************************/
00110 int c_entry(void) { /* Main Program */
00111 
00112         uint32_t temp;
00113 
00114         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00115          * – 115200bps
00116          * – 8 data bit
00117          * – No parity
00118          * – 1 stop bit
00119          * – No flow control
00120          */
00121         debug_frmwrk_init();
00122         //print menu
00123         _DBG(menu);
00124 
00125         /* test Bit-banding SRAM first --------------------------------------------------------- */
00126         _DBG_("Test bit-band SRAM... ");
00127 
00128         //read variable at VAR_ADDRESS
00129         temp = (*(volatile uint32_t *)(VAR_ADDRESS));
00130         //print temp value
00131         _DBG("The value at address "); _DBH32(VAR_ADDRESS); _DBG(": ");
00132         _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00133 
00134         /* Use bitband function to read VAR_BIT value */
00135         temp = BITBAND_SRAM_GetBit(VAR_ADDRESS,VAR_BIT);
00136         _DBG("Use bit-band function to get value at bit 3: ");_DBG_("");
00137         _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00138 
00139         /* clear bit */
00140         BITBAND_SRAM_ClearBit(VAR_ADDRESS,VAR_BIT);
00141         /* re-read temp value */
00142         temp = (*(volatile uint32_t *)(VAR_ADDRESS));
00143         _DBG("Value after clear bit 3 value by using bit-band function: ");_DBG_("");
00144         _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00145 
00146         /* Set bit */
00147         BITBAND_SRAM_SetBit(VAR_ADDRESS,VAR_BIT);
00148         /* re-read temp value */
00149         temp = (*(volatile uint32_t *)(VAR_ADDRESS));
00150         _DBG("Value after set bit 3 value by using bit-band function: ");_DBG_("");
00151         _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00152         _DBG_("");
00153 
00154         /* Then, test Bit-banding PERI --------------------------------------------------------- */
00155         _DBG_("Test bit-band PERIPHERAL... ");
00156 
00157         LPC_SPI->SPCR =(1<<5)|(1<<3)|(10<<8);
00158 
00159         /* Read the current value of peripheral register */
00160         temp = (*(volatile uint32_t *)(PERI_ADDRESS));
00161         _DBG("The value of peripheral register at "); _DBH32(PERI_ADDRESS); _DBG(": ");_DBG_("");
00162         _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00163 
00164         /* Use bitband function to read VAR_BIT value */
00165         temp = BITBAND_PERI_GetBit(PERI_ADDRESS,PERI_BIT);
00166         _DBG("Use bit-band function to get value at bit 5: ");_DBG_(""); _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00167 
00168         /* clear bit */
00169         BITBAND_PERI_ClearBit(PERI_ADDRESS,PERI_BIT);
00170         /* re-read temp value */
00171         temp = (*(volatile uint32_t *)(PERI_ADDRESS));
00172         _DBG("Peripheral register after clear bit 5 value by using bit-band function: ");_DBG_("");
00173         _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00174 
00175         /* Set bit */
00176         BITBAND_PERI_SetBit(PERI_ADDRESS,PERI_BIT);
00177         /* re-read temp value */
00178         temp = (*(volatile uint32_t *)(PERI_ADDRESS));
00179         _DBG("Peripheral register after set bit 5 value by using bit-band function: ");_DBG_("");
00180         _DBH32(temp); _DBG_("");
00181 
00182         while (1);
00183         return 0;
00184 }
00185 
00186 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00187  allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00188  heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00189  toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00190  file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00191 int main(void) {
00192         return c_entry();
00193 }
00194 
00195 #ifdef  DEBUG

00197  * @brief               Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00198  *                              where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00199  * @param[in]   file Pointer to the source file name
00200  * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00201  * @return              None
00202  *******************************************************************************/
00203 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line) {
00204         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00205          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00206 
00207         /* Infinite loop */
00208         while (1)
00209                 ;
00210 }
